segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 44
segments.en: Linked Discourses 44

segments.pli: 1. Abyākatavagga
segments.en: 1. The Undeclared Points

segments.pli: 9. Kutūhalasālāsutta
segments.en: 9. The Debating Hall

segments.pli: Atha kho vacchagotto paribbājako yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṃ sammodi.
segments.en: Then the wanderer Vacchagotta went up to the Buddha and exchanged greetings with him.

segments.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho vacchagotto paribbājako bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side, and said to the Buddha:

segments.pli: “Purimāni, bho gotama, divasāni purimatarāni sambahulānaṃ nānātitthiyānaṃ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ kutūhalasālāyaṃ sannisinnānaṃ sannipatitānaṃ ayamantarākathā udapādi:
segments.en: “Master Gotama, a few days ago several ascetics, brahmins, and wanderers who follow various other paths were sitting together in the debating hall, and this discussion came up among them:

segments.pli: ‘ayaṃ kho pūraṇo kassapo saṅghī ceva gaṇī ca gaṇācariyo ca ñāto yasassī titthakaro sādhusammato bahujanassa.
segments.en: ‘This Pūraṇa Kassapa leads an order and a community, and teaches a community. He’s a well-known and famous religious founder, regarded as holy by many people.

segments.pli: Sopi sāvakaṃ abbhatītaṃ kālaṅkataṃ upapattīsu byākaroti:
segments.en: When a disciple passes away, he declares that

segments.pli: “asu amutra upapanno, asu amutra upapanno”ti.
segments.en: this one is reborn here, while that one is reborn there.

segments.pli: Yopissa sāvako uttamapuriso paramapuriso paramapattipatto tampi sāvakaṃ abbhatītaṃ kālaṅkataṃ upapattīsu byākaroti:
segments.en: And as for a disciple who is a supreme person, highest of people, having reached the highest point, when they pass away he also declares that

segments.pli: “asu amutra upapanno, asu amutra upapanno”ti.
segments.en: this one is reborn here, while that one is reborn there.

segments.pli: Ayampi kho makkhali gosālo … pe …
segments.en: This Makkhali Gosāla …

segments.pli: ayampi kho nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto … pe …
segments.en: Nigaṇṭha Nāṭaputta …

segments.pli: ayampi kho sañcayo belaṭṭhaputto … pe …
segments.en: Sañjaya Belaṭṭhiputta …

segments.pli: ayampi kho pakudho kaccāno … pe …
segments.en: Pakudha Kaccāyana …

segments.pli: ayampi kho ajito kesakambalo saṃghī ceva gaṇī ca gaṇācariyo ca ñāto yasassī titthakaro sādhusammato bahujanassa.
segments.en: Ajita Kesakambala leads an order and a community, and teaches a community. He’s a well-known and famous religious founder, regarded as holy by many people.

segments.pli: Sopi sāvakaṃ abbhatītaṃ kālaṅkataṃ upapattīsu byākaroti:
segments.en: When a disciple passes away, he declares that

segments.pli: “asu amutra upapanno, asu amutra upapanno”ti.
segments.en: this one is reborn here, while that one is reborn there.

segments.pli: Yopissa sāvako uttamapuriso paramapuriso paramapattipatto tampi sāvakaṃ abbhatītaṃ kālaṅkataṃ upapattīsu byākaroti:
segments.en: And as for a disciple who is a supreme person, highest of people, having reached the highest point, when they pass away he also declares that

segments.pli: “asu amutra upapanno, asu amutra upapanno”’ti.
segments.en: this one is reborn here, while that one is reborn there.

segments.pli: Ayampi kho samaṇo gotamo saṃghī ceva gaṇī ca gaṇācariyo ca ñāto yasassī titthakaro sādhusammato bahujanassa.
segments.en: This ascetic Gotama leads an order and a community, and teaches a community. He’s a well-known and famous religious founder, regarded as holy by many people.

segments.pli: Sopi sāvakaṃ abbhatītaṃ kālaṅkataṃ upapattīsu byākaroti:
segments.en: When a disciple passes away, he declares that

segments.pli: ‘asu amutra upapanno, asu amutra upapanno’ti.
segments.en: this one is reborn here, while that one is reborn there.

segments.pli: Yopissa sāvako uttamapuriso paramapuriso paramapattipatto tañca sāvakaṃ abbhatītaṃ kālaṅkataṃ upapattīsu na byākaroti:
segments.en: But as for a disciple who is a supreme person, highest of people, having reached the highest point, when they pass away he doesn’t declare that

segments.pli: ‘asu amutra upapanno, asu amutra upapanno’ti.
segments.en: this one is reborn here, while that one is reborn there.

segments.pli: Api ca kho naṃ evaṃ byākaroti:
segments.en: Rather, he declares that they have

segments.pli: ‘acchecchi taṇhaṃ, vivattayi saṃyojanaṃ, sammā mānābhisamayā antamakāsi dukkhassā’ti.
segments.en: cut off craving, untied the fetters, and by rightly comprehending conceit have made an end of suffering.

segments.pli: Tassa mayhaṃ, bho gotama, ahu deva kaṅkhā, ahu vicikicchā:
segments.en: I had doubt and uncertainty about that:

segments.pli: ‘kathaṃ nāma samaṇassa gotamassa dhammo abhiññeyyo’”ti?
segments.en: ‘How on earth can I understand the ascetic Gotama’s teaching?’”

segments.pli: “Alañhi te, vaccha, kaṅkhituṃ, alaṃ vicikicchituṃ.
segments.en: “Vaccha, no wonder you’re doubting and uncertain.

segments.pli: Kaṅkhanīye ca pana te ṭhāne vicikicchā uppannā.
segments.en: Doubt has come up in you about an uncertain matter.

segments.pli: Saupādānassa khvāhaṃ, vaccha, upapattiṃ paññāpemi no anupādānassa.
segments.en: I describe rebirth for someone who grasps fuel, not for someone who doesn’t grasp fuel.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, vaccha, aggi saupādāno jalati, no anupādāno;
segments.en: It’s like a fire which only burns with fuel, not without fuel.

segments.pli: evameva khvāhaṃ, vaccha, saupādānassa upapattiṃ paññāpemi, no anupādānassā”ti.
segments.en: In the same way I describe rebirth for someone who grasps fuel, not for someone who doesn’t grasp fuel.”

segments.pli: “Yasmiṃ, bho gotama, samaye acci vātena khittā dūrampi gacchati, imassa pana bhavaṃ gotamo kiṃ upādānasmiṃ paññāpetī”ti?
segments.en: “But when a flame is blown away by the wind, what do you say is its fuel then?”

segments.pli: “Yasmiṃ kho, vaccha, samaye acci vātena khittā dūrampi gacchati, tamahaṃ vātūpādānaṃ paññāpemi.
segments.en: “At such a time, I say that it’s fueled by wind.

segments.pli: Vāto hissa, vaccha, tasmiṃ samaye upādānaṃ hotī”ti.
segments.en: For the wind is its fuel then.”

segments.pli: “Yasmiñca pana, bho gotama, samaye imañca kāyaṃ nikkhipati, satto ca aññataraṃ kāyaṃ anupapanno hoti, imassa pana bhavaṃ gotamo kiṃ upādānasmiṃ paññāpetī”ti?
segments.en: “But when someone who is attached has laid down this body and has not been reborn in one of the realms, what does Master Gotama say is their fuel then?”

segments.pli: “Yasmiṃ kho, vaccha, samaye imañca kāyaṃ nikkhipati, satto ca aññataraṃ kāyaṃ anupapanno hoti, tamahaṃ taṇhūpādānaṃ vadāmi.
segments.en: “When someone who is attached has laid down this body, Vaccha, and has not been reborn in one of the realms, I say they’re fueled by craving.

segments.pli: Taṇhā hissa, vaccha, tasmiṃ samaye upādānaṃ hotī”ti.
segments.en: For craving is their fuel then.”

segments.pli: Navamaṃ.

sections.title: Then the wanderer Vacchagotta went up to the Buddha…

suttaplex.blurb: The wanderer Vacchagotta reports to the Buddha a conversation among ascetics on the views of the six heretical teachers as to where a perfected one is reborn. Unsure of what the Buddha’s position was, he asks how it is to be understood. The Buddha says it is like a flame that burns dependent on fuel, and goes out when that fuel is extinguished.
